question.text: Arrange the following salts in increases order of their <math><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math> of <math><mn>0.1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi></math> solution

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></math>

solution.text:
NH4Cl undergoes cationic hydrolysis hence pH is <7 because the solution due to cationic hydrolysis in acids.
NaCN undergoes anionic hydrolysis hence pH is >7 .
HCl is strong acid and NaCl is neutral solution.
Hence the pH of given solutions will increases.
HCl<NH4Cl<NaCl<NaCN
